Using Dictionaries

A dictionary maps keys to values - it is a look-up table which allows you to store an unlimited amount of data, retrievable by looking up the key value.

Quest has three different dictionary types. Keys are always string, but the value type depends on the dictionary used:

  • stringdictionary has values of type string
  • scriptdictionary has values of type script
  • objectdictionary has values of type object

You can create some types of new dictionary during the game using the relevant function:

  • NewStringDictionary
  • NewObjectDictionary

To add an item to a dictionary, use the dictionary add command. To remove an item, use dictionary remove.

To retrieve an item for a dictionary:

  • if the type of dictionary is variable, use DictionaryItem
  • for stringdictionary, use StringDictionaryItem
  • for scriptdictionary, use ScriptDictionaryItem
  • for objectdictionary, use ObjectDictionaryItem

You can see if a dictionary contains a particular key using the DictionaryContains function, and get the number of items using DictionaryCount.
